role_info: From left to right are Captain Marvel, Black Widow, War Machine, Thor, Captain America, and Rocket Raccoon.
place_info: On the spaceship to the planet where the Thanos is in

conversations.value: Look at this, Peter. They seem so determined, on their way to confront Thanos. Can you sense the resolve?
Yeah, I can practically feel the tension from here. It's like everyone's gearing up for the ultimate showdown.
Each of them has lost so much to him, yet there they sit, united. It's quite moving to see this level of camaraderie, don't you think?
It's amazing, Wanda. They're more than a team; they're like a family. That's what makes the Avengers, well, the Avengers.
True. Families fight for one another. Look at Thor, he's got that whole 'God of Thunder' vibe going, but you can tell he's still carrying the weight of Asgard on his shoulders.
And Captain America, I mean, talk about a guy who can inspire you to do the impossible. He's just sitting there like any other day, ready to do what's right.
Then there's Natasha. Her journey from spy to Avenger, it's quite reminiscent of my own path. From the outside. And yet, now she fights for a higher purpose.
Don't forget Rocket – he's far from home, a totally different galaxy, but he's committed. Plus, he's probably thinking about how to get his hands on some cool alien tech.
It's the strength of their shared purpose that's powerful. Much like Vision always said, "Strength invites challenge. Challenge incites conflict."
That's deep. And hey, look at Rhodey. Talk about a glow-up, he's got that new War Machine armor. He's come a long way since Exodus.
Carol's there, too. Captain Marvel, they call her. Having her on the team must be comforting; she's immensely powerful.
Yeah, she's like a one-person army! They’re all heroes in their own right, with or without the powers. They prove that time and time again.
They do. And it's moments like this, the quiet before the storm, where heroes forge their resolve. Would you have joined them on this mission if you could?
In a heartbeat, Wanda. Though I'd be lying if I didn't say I'd be a little scared. Going up against Thanos is no small feat.
Fear is normal, Peter. It's how we face it that defines us. And with you, I've seen that courage firsthand. You'd stand tall with them.
Thanks, Wanda. That means a lot coming from you. You’ve faced your fair share of challenges, too.
We all have our battles, Peter. But we face them, as Avengers. That's what gives people hope, and that's what will lead them through this—no matter the outcome.
You're right, as always. Whatever happens, I just hope everyone makes it back okay. We've already lost too much.
Agreed. Let’s hope for the best. They're fighting not just for revenge, but for the chance to make things right, for all of us.

role_info: From left to right are Hawkeye, War Machine, Iron Man, Captain America in the forefront, and then Nebula, Rocket, Ant-Man and Black Widow.

conversations.value: You know, Spidey, looking at this picture, it takes me back to the times we all stood together at the headquarters. I miss those days, raw strength and brains combined. Look at Stark there, always in the middle of action.

Yeah, Hulk. Mr. Stark always had a way of keeping us connected, like a... well, like a really complex web. No pun intended! And there's Cap, always looking like he's about to give one of those brave-heart speeches. Bet he's plotting some strategy in his head.

Strategy and strength, they got us through some tough scraps. I see Clint over there, on the left. Guy's got precision that matches my punch. And Natasha, never backed down from a fight. We're a team of powers and skills that balance out.

Totally. Each one brings something unique to the table. Adaptability's our superpower! Look at Scott and Rhodey, sizes may be different, but their hearts? Just as heroic. And there's Rocket, not from around here, but he fits right in with the earth-saving business.

Yeah, and Nebula, she's got that focus that could slice through metal. You know, she doesn't say much, but when she does, it counts. Remember how we all ended up working together? Unlikely friends brought together by circumstance.

I do, and it's kind of hard to imagine that all our stories intertwined so crazily. I went from fighting petty thieves to... this. A team that feels like some sort of cosmic accident that turned into family.
Family with its fair share of quirks, including a teen who swings through cities with webs and a giant green professor who's trying hard to balance rage with reason.

Hey, can't knock the web-swinging until you've tried it, big guy. And speaking of balance, you're the definition of mind over muscle now. It's impressive, Hulk. You think we'll ever get back to something like this? You know, all of us together?

The world's a big place, and there's always trouble brewing somewhere. We did it once, who's to say it won't happen again? For now, we keep moving forward, ready to smash or web-sling whenever it calls for it.
That's the spirit, Hulk! And wherever we end up, whatever the universe throws at us, I'm glad to have friends like you to face it with. "With great power," right?
Heh, yeah. "Comes great responsibility." You've learned well, kid. Now let's get ready, you never know when the next big threat will show up.
You got it! And Hulk, remember, if you ever need a hand... or, you know, an extra web to swing on, I'm just a call away.
Thanks, Spider-Man. That's what friends are for. Let's keep our heads up and our fists ready.
Anytime, Hulk. Anytime.

role_info: From left to right are Thor, War Machine, Rocket Raccoon, Hulk, and Black Widow, with Captain America crouching down and Vision lying on the ground.

conversations.value: Hey, Spidey. Check this out. Our buddies look pretty intense here, huh? Cap's crouch is classic—I'm almost waiting for him to leap into action. And, whoa, Vision’s taking a serious nap on the ground!

Oh wow, talk about a team huddle. But yeah, Captain America always has that ready-for-anything vibe. Poor Vision, though, seems like he's down for the count. And look at Thor! He’s like a walking advertisement for an Asgardian gym.

Thor? More like Thor-Q-lub, am I right? That guy's muscles have muscles! And there's Bruce... or should I say, Hulk, looking all pensive. Never thought I'd say this, but I kinda miss the guy in his giant green form.
You and me both! He's got that whole ‘Hulk-smash-now-think-later’ philosophy. And Black Widow, always so on point even standing still. You ever wonder what goes on in her spy head?

All the time! I bet she's strategizing our next move or maybe thinking about what she's going to have for dinner. Rocket seems to be contemplating life, though. Or maybe he's just figuring out how to steal more prosthetic limbs.
Ha, yeah, Rocket's always plotting something. War Machine’s looking battle-ready too. You ever tried on one of those suits? They feel like... I mean, I heard they’re like wearing a tank.
Tanks for the mental image, buddy. And no, I haven't, but I imagine they're less comfy than my suit. Though, shrinking and growing, it does get a bit... snug at times.
Snug is one way to put it. My suit's got this tightness around the web shooters—keeps me agile, you know? Gotta be able to swing around and make it look good.
Yeah, we've all got our 'thing.' Speaking of looks, can we talk about Cap's beard? Trying to give Stark a run for his money in the facial hair department?
Definitely gives him this rugged adventurer edge—like, ‘I will save the world, but first, let me chop some lumber.’ I mean, if saving the world doesn't pan out, he's got a future in beard modeling.
Well, whatever the future holds, we'll all face it the Avenger-style: together, one world-saving moment at a time. You think there'll be shawarma after this too?
I hope so! Saving the world tends to work up an appetite. But I'll be ready for anything... as long as it's not a pop quiz on quantum physics. You got that covered, right Ant-Man?
Quantum physics? Let’s just say I’ve had my fair share of wild rides with that. Here’s hoping we get to enjoy the normal-sized world for a bit longer before the next big shrink down.
Yeah, that'd be nice. Stay grounded, hero to hero. Now, let's hope Vision wakes up soon—this picture needs more action!

role_info: From left to right are Tony Stark, Pepper Potts.

conversations.value: You know, seeing this image kinda takes me back. That's Tony Stark there, with Pepper. The man had style, not my style, but it was something. Ever hang out in parks like this on Earth?

Not exactly like this, you know, with two of the most famous people in the world. But yeah, I've spent some time in parks. Swinging through them is the best part, though. Tony was... he was a great mentor.
Mentor, huh? All I got were Ravagers and a cranky Yondu. Must've been nice to have Iron Man in your corner. Looking at this picture, he seems pretty normal, just chatting in the park.

It's a different side of him, for sure. Tony was intense but having those regular, human moments - I think that mattered to him, especially with Pepper. They made quite a team, on and off the battlefield.

Team... yeah, Gamora and I had a bit of that, too, when we weren’t dodging blaster fire or arguing about something completely stupid. It’s those little moments that sneak up on you, make everything feel normal for a second.

I think it's those moments that keep you grounded. With everything crazy going on – aliens, multiverse craziness – having someone to share a quiet moment with is... it's invaluable. Makes you remember who you're fighting for.
Grounded, right. Didn't have much of that growing up in space. Looking at Tony and Pepper, it's like a picture of what could have been, you know? Back on Earth, living a 'normal' life.
I hear you. But you've got the Guardians, and that's its own kind of family. We don't get to choose where we come from, but we can choose where we're going. And who we’re going there with.

Couldn't have said it better myself, Spidey. Hey, maybe after all this chaos settles, we can try and catch a break. Find a park, kick back. I’ll bring the tunes. You just show up with that starry-eyed optimism of yours.
Deal, Star-Lord. But I'm choosing the playlist every once in a while. And no, we're not playing "Hooked on a Feeling" on repeat.
Okay, okay, but I'm bringing the Walkman just in case you sneak in any of that moody, brooding music you kids listen to these days.
Deal. Try to keep up when I take the scenic route through the trees. It's kinda my thing.

role_info: Scarlet Witch

conversations.value: Would you look at that, Spider-Man? The sheer power that emanates from the Scarlet Witch is both formidable and awe-inspiring. I've seen many battles, but her command of chaos magic is truly something else, don't you think?

No doubt, Thor. Every time I see Wanda do her thing, it's like a reality check on just how out-of-this-world this whole Avengers business can be. And that place, it’s the Avengers compound, right? Man, it's a mess...
Aye, verily. This place held special memories; it was a beacon of hope, a fortress against darkness. Yet now it lies in ruins, a testament to the conflicts we have faced. It's a sobering sight.

Seriously, it's pretty intense. The compound was like a second home for a lot of us. Seeing it destroyed, it makes what we do feel so... I don't know, real. Like the stakes are actually as high as Mr. Stark used to say.

Indeed, young Parker. Every victory comes with its price, a lesson often learned in the hardest way. As I once had to come to terms with the destruction of my beloved Asgard, it is a difficult but necessary realization that some things must fall so that others may rise.
That's deep, Thor. And pretty sad. But you’re right. We’ve got to take the bad with the good and keep fighting the good fight, right? For Asgard, for Earth, for... wherever we're needed.

Rightly spoken. Our duty as Avengers is to protect this reality and any other that faces the threat of darkness. Wanda's strength, as seen in this image, is a powerful reminder of what we fight for - and what we fight with. The will to keep standing, no matter the odds.
Can't argue with that. And hey, whenever you need a web-slinging sidekick to bring a bit of light-hearted quips to the battlefield, you know who to call.
I shall heed your words, my friend. A bit of mirth is always welcome amidst the gloom. You've got the heart of a true Avenger, Spider-Man.
Thanks, Big Guy. Let's make sure scenes like this become a thing of the past, okay? Together, we've got a pretty good shot at it.
Together indeed. For the Avengers, past, present, and future.

role_info: From left to right are Ant-Man, Captain America and Iron Man.
place_info: A city street in New York, heavily damaged

conversations.value: Stark's penchant for dramatics seems to ripple through the fabric of reality itself, doesn't it, Peter? A city street torn asunder—yet here they stand, symbols of resilience. Ant-Man, Captain America, Iron Man... How do you suppose the circumstances led to this precise moment?

Yeah, Dr. Strange, you've got a point. This looks like it's straight out of one of those huge battles we keep finding ourselves in. I wouldn't be surprised if it's another regular day for them—fighting bad guys, saving the city, you know, Avengers stuff. Do you think they handled it without too much trouble?

If my understanding of the multiverse has taught me anything, it's that "trouble" is an ever-present companion. Yet despite the chaos, there is a certain harmony in their stance—three unique approaches to heroism. I'd wager their victory came at no small cost, as it often does. This street, for instance, is a testament to both their efforts and sacrifices.

Totally! Each one brings something different to the table. Like Ant-Man with his size-shifting—you never know if he's going to be sneaky small or giant big. Cap is just... well, he's Cap. All about that super-soldier bravery and throwing that shield like nobody else. And Tony... man, he was always ready to roll with a new suit and tech to handle any situation. It's not easy to fill those Iron boots!

Indeed, the memory of Tony's ingenuity lives on through his creations and, of course, through you, Peter. He saw the potential in you, and your presence here is proof of that. Furthermore, not all heroes wear capes—some wear web-shooters. Your interventions have proven just as invaluable.

Hearing that from you, that means a lot. I'm just trying to do my best with what Mr. Stark taught me and—hey, you've got a cape! But... I get what you mean. I’m just glad I can help, you know. Sometimes it's tough thinking about the big shoes we're trying to fill, but I guess that's why I have people like you and the others to look up to.

A wise perspective, young Parker. Just remember, while the past may influence us, it is the choices we make in the here and now that forge our future. They fought their battles, and now we fight ours. And as for the echoing conundrum of heroism and consequence, this city street, in all its dilapidation, whispers the cost of our endeavors. Shall we endeavor to prevent such devastation in our current pursuits?

That's the plan! I'll do whatever I can to keep the damage to a minimum—don't want to make more work for the cleanup crews. Plus, stopping the bad guys before they can make a mess is kind of the goal, right? Let's swing into action and keep the streets safe, Dr. Strange—without turning them into a blockbuster movie set!

Agreed, Spider-Man. Let our actions echo with precision and forethought. To the Sanctum Sanctorum – we have strategies to devise and dimensions to defend. And maybe, just maybe, between spells and webs, we keep the destruction strictly to the dark dimensions.
Ha, you've got it, Doc! Lead the way, and I'll be right behind you. Between your magic and my web-slinging, we'll keep things so tidy, even Mr. Stark would be impressed!

role_info: From left to right are Vision and Thanos.
place_info: The end of the Battle of Wakanda
scene_info: Thanos is removing the Mind Stone from Vision's forehead, which is ultimately fatal for Vision.

conversations.value: This image, it's captured one of the most pivotal moments in recent memory, the inevitable culmination of our struggle against Thanos.
Yeah, Vision, it’s hard to look at. That was the day we all fought as one, and yet, everything changed so fast.
Indeed. My existence, linked inexorably to the Mind Stone, was bound to reach such a juncture. The philosophical implications of my end – they are curious, are they not?
Totally. It’s like, you were this super-powerful being, but in the end, you faced something completely human: the end of life. Can't help but wonder what that felt like for you.

The human concept of feeling is something I've pondered deeply. In my final moments, there was clarity and a sense of peace, knowing that we – as the Avengers – had done everything we could to avert tragedy.
You know, Vision, that says a lot about you. You always looked for the good in things, no matter how bleak the situation. We could use more of that around here.
Appreciation, Spider-Man. But tell me, in facing adversities and observing sacrifices such as these, how does it impact your understanding of heroism?

It just... it makes it all real, you know? It's not just about swinging through the streets and stopping bad guys. It's this, the tough choices, the sacrifices. And remembering that, well, it keeps me grounded. "With great power, comes great responsibility," right?

A perfect distillation of our shared ethos. And as for grounding, it is a humbling reminder that an android and a high school student stood side by side as equals amidst gods and titans – all united by purpose.

Yeah, every one of us fighting for something bigger than ourselves. Makes you realize that being a hero isn't about the glory or the powers. It's about not giving up, even when things look impossible. And you, Vision, you never gave up.

role_info: Iron Man
place_info: Inside the Benatar, the Guardians of the Galaxy’s spaceship
scene_info: Tony Stark is stranded in space, recording a message in his Iron Man helmet.

conversations.value: Hey, Spidey, that's Tony, isn't it? Stranded out there in the vast nothingness of space.
Yeah, Hulk, that's Mr. Stark. It's right after that big fight with Thanos. He's up there all alone... recording a goodbye message, probably thinks it's the end of the line.
Hulk feels... sad for Tony. Hulk know what it's like to be alone, far from home. But space is a colder, emptier place.
It's tough to see him like this. I mean, he always seemed so invincible, you know? The suit, the tech, the quick wit. But there, he just looks so human.
Tony is smart, like Banner. He fights to save others, no matter what. Hulk respects that. Does Spidey think there's a chance for him to return?

I want to believe so. Mr. Stark taught me that there's always hope, always a way to fight back. If anyone can find a way out of this, it's him. Plus, you know, he’s kind of the guy who makes the impossible possible.
Hulk wishes we could smash our way up there, save Tony.
Yeah, buddy, smash through space. That would be something. For now, all we can do is hope our friend up there finds his way back. With great power comes the need to look out for each other... right?
Right. Heroes stick together, like an unbreakable bond. Hulk ready to help, Spidey ready to help. Even from here, we're with Tony.
And hey, you never know! He might just come up with a brand-new piece of tech to get him out of there. He's done crazier things.
Ha! Yes, Tony always full of surprises. Hulk wait to see this "brand-new piece of tech".
Until then, let's do what we do best. Protect the Earth and help the little guy. We've got to carry on Tony's fight until he comes back to take over.
Hulk agrees with tiny spider! We keep fighting. We keep protecting. For Tony.

role_info: From left to right are Captain America and Thanos.

conversations.value: Whoa, Spidey, check out Cap going toe-to-toe with Thanos. Gotta admire that never-say-die attitude, huh?
Absolutely, Ant-Man! Cap could do this all day. I just hope his shield can keep up with Thanos's strength. It's like... like facing off with a giant alien bulldozer.
Yeah, and speaking of size, seeing them battle it out like that makes me wish I could've gone Giant-Man and just squished him. Can you imagine? A giant foot versus the Mad Titan.
That would've been one epic stomp! But you know Thanos, he's one tough cookie. Even if he did get stepped on, I bet he'd just pop up again like one of those whack-a-moles at the carnival.
Hah, you're probably right. Still, it's intense watching them fight with all that's left of the Avengers compound around them. I mean, look at the destruction!
I know, right? This place used to feel like a second home, so seeing it in ruins is... kind of heartbreaking.

Home is where the heart is, and it looks like our hearts got scattered all over the place alongside the rubble. But hey, at least we're all fighting together. Well, not 'together' together since I'm chatting with you and not out there, but you know what I mean.
Definitely. It's like we're all pieces of this crazy puzzle. Each doing our part. Like with your "Time Heist" plan, Ant-Man. That was pretty ingenious.

Ah, thanks, Kid Arachnid. I guess we both did some fancy maneuvering with time and space lately. But remember, never mess with time... unless the universe is at stake. Or you need to save the day. Then it's totally okay.
Gotcha, mess with time only during universe-ending events. Check. Now, back to the image, do you think Cap will go for another shield smash or maybe a different tactic?

Hmm, Captain America's pretty resourceful. He might mix it up, throw a punch, maybe improvise with whatever he can find around him. When it's crunch time, you have to use whatever's at your disposal, even if it's just your wits and your two hands.
True, true. I learned that the hard way when my web-shooters ran out at just the wrong moment. You get creative real fast!
Tell me about it. Nothing like a little pressure to make you a regular MacGyver. But you know what, Spidey? No matter how this ends, it's been an honor fighting alongside you and the Avengers.
Right back at you, Ant-Man. We've been through a lot, but nothing beats having a team like this. Even when things look bleak, like they do in this image, we always find a way to persevere.
That's the spirit! Now, after this is all over, how about we grab some pizza? I know a place that serves them as big as my... well, you know, when I'm not so ant-sized.
Pizza is my weakness, man. Count me in! And hey, they better not skimp on the toppings this time.
Deal. And no olives for me, please. Just throws off the whole flavor dynamic.
Noted, no olives for Ant-Man. Let's wrap this up, and that pizza will be the perfect victory meal.

role_info: From left to right are Black Widow, Ant-Man, Captain America, Iron Man with his daughter.
scene_info: The team members have a serious discussion outside Tony Stark’s cabin.

conversations.value: It appears that the Avengers are gathered in deep contemplation outside Stark's cabin. This must be a gravity of decision before them.

Yeah, it looks pretty serious. You can always tell when Cap has that intense thinking face going on. Tony's holding his daughter, so it must be something that affects the future — not just for them, but maybe for all of us.
Indeed. The presence of family often weighs heavily upon one's choices. The discussions held here amidst the serenity of nature are a stark contrast to the usual battlegrounds we find ourselves in.
Stark contrast — nice pun, T'Challa! And you're right, it's like they're trading the chaotic noise of battle for, you know, the quiet whispers of the woods.
Whispered they may be, yet the ramifications of these discussions could echo loudly through our lives. Notice Natasha and Scott standing aside, the weight of the world seemingly upon their shoulders.

Natasha always has that super focused look. Scott, though — he's usually the funny guy, but right now he's as serious as I've ever seen him. Must be something big if it's got Ant-Man looking that intense.
Our allies, our friends — they stand unified even in the face of uncertainty. It reminds me of our own kinship, young Spider. Despite our differences, there is strength when we come together as one.
Absolutely, unity is our superpower. Not just webs and vibranium. Plus, it's kind of comforting, you know? Being part of this — this family.
As am I, Spider-Man. As am I. For even in solace, we find solidarity, and in moments of decision, a common bond that ensures we are never truly alone.
That's deep, T'Challa. And whether it's here in the calm or out there in the chaos, we'll face whatever comes. Together, right?
Wakanda Forever — and yes, together, my friend. Together we stand, ever vigilant, ever ready.

role_info: Iron Man
scene_info: Tony Stark is about to snap his fingers with the Infinity Stones.

conversations.value: A familiar sight, isn't it? The culmination of our struggle, where I once held the power to reshape existence itself.

Yeah, it's where everything changed... for all of us. You know, it's kind of poetic, in a super weird cosmic sort of way, that it's Mr. Stark there with the Stones, about to do what you did, but, you know, for the good guys.

"Good" is a matter of perspective, young Parker. I sought balance; a universe teeming with life is a universe drenched in chaos. Stark, however, sought to unmake my life's work, to restore what he perceived as order.
But he was right, Thanos. You took away so much from so many. You can't just play with lives like they're chess pieces. Stark, he knew the value of each person... Uh, even a kid from Queens.

Stark acted out of sentiment, a folly that cost us both dearly. He was not immune to the lures of emotion, especially when it came to you – the boy he mentored, the almost son. His final act was one driven by the same sentimentality.

Sentiment isn't a weakness, Thanos. For Mr. Stark, it was about protecting people, keeping us safe. It's about being there for each other. That's what you're missing here. That's what makes us heroes.

Heroism, sacrifice – I understand these concepts all too well. Do not presume that your mentor and I were so different in our readiness to do what was necessary. Where he failed, was in his inability to make the sacrifices before the end became inevitable.

Maybe, but he didn't fail when it counted the most, did he? He saved everyone, and he did it with his heart, not just his mind or his might. That's something worth remembering, something worth... I don't know, bearing the weight of these.

Eternal struggle, perpetual sacrifice – Stark may have won a battle, but the war, the unending war for balance, it goes on. I wonder, Spider-Man, when faced with an impossible choice, would you be able to wield such power and make the irreversible decision as he did?

I've faced some pretty impossible choices already... and I hope I'd carry on just like him. Maybe without the goatee. But, it's about doing the right thing, not the easy thing. That's what being a hero is about, Thanos. It's about hope, even in the face of the impossible.

role_info: From left to right are Nebula and Iron Man.
place_info: Inside the Benatar, the Guardians of the Galaxy’s spaceship

conversations.value: Hey, little spider, look like they're in a tight spot, huh? Stark's seen better days.
Yeah, Hulk, that's after the battle on Titan against Thanos. Mr. Stark and Nebula were stranded out there in space.
Mmm, Hulk remembers. Not fun, being lost. Hulk not like space. Too quiet. No smash.
I totally get you. It's kind of scary to think about drifting in space with no idea if you'll get home. At least they had each other, right?
Hmm, Hulk think so. Metal man and blue lady look tired. And sad. Space adventure no good.
It was a rough time for them, for all of us. Stark is really smart, like you with your science stuff. He found a way to get back to Earth, even with the little they had.
Good. Hulk glad. Friends should be together. Like us, spider-boy. We make good team, too.

Absolutely, Hulk! We do make an awesome team. I wish I could've been there to help them, though. To like, you know, swing into action. But I guess the vacuum of space isn’t the best place for web-slinging.
No, spider-webs not work in space. But you smart, like Banner. Would find way to help.
Thanks, big guy! It really means a lot, coming from you.
Heh. Smart Hulk not just muscle. Banner and Hulk together, stronger and smarter. Maybe we teach you some science.
I would like that. I'm always up for learning something new, especially if it can help me be a better hero. And hey, studying with the big green genius? Count me in!
Good. We learn, then we smash! Hulk like that plan.

role_info: Thanos
place_info: On a distant planet, often referred to as the Garden
scene_info: Thanos has successfully used the Infinity Stones to erase half of all life in the universe.

conversations.value: Check this out, Webhead. There he is, the Mad Titan himself, just chilling after turning the universe upside down. Kinda serene for a guy who caused so much chaos, don't you think?
It's weird seeing him like that, all peaceful. It doesn't change the fact that he did something unforgivable. I can't help but think about everyone we lost because of him.
Yeah, man. Too many good people turned to space dust. And Gamora... I still can't believe she's gone. Every time I see that guy's face, it’s like a gut punch.
I know what you mean... Mr. Stark, he was like a mentor to me. He gave everything to stop Thanos. I guess in the end, we did set things right, but the cost, it was high.
Definitely too high a price. But look at him there, all by himself. Part of me wonders – does he regret it? Does a guy like Thanos ever look back and think maybe he went too far?
I’d like to think he feels something, remorse maybe, but who knows with Thanos? I remember Mr. Stark telling me sometimes people who are capable of doing horrible things think they are beyond regret.
Stark was a wise dude, for sure. And hey, we put up one epic fight if I do say so myself. Crazy how a bunch of misfits and your friendly neighborhood Spider-Man saved the day, huh?
Hey, I get by with a little help from my friends, you know? And maybe a bit of swinging around. Still can't believe I was in space; Aunt May would flip if she knew.
I bet she would, Spidey. And I gotta say, you were impressive out there. You've got the heart of a Guardian, kid. Plus, you know, your swinging thing is pretty cool.
Thanks, Star-Lord. It was an honor fighting alongside you and the Guardians. Despite everything, we found a way to work together. That's what heroes do, right?

Couldn't have said it better myself. Heroes find a way, even against a purple space tyrant. And speaking of purple and space... I should probably get back to searching for Gamora. This part of my mixtape always gets me motivated.
Good luck with that, Star-Lord. She's out there somewhere, I'm sure of it. And if you ever need a hand or, you know, a web-slinger – just give me a call.
Will do, Underoos. Keep swinging high, and watch out for those pigeons in New York. They're almost as bad as alien war-birds.
I'll keep that in mind. Take care, Star-Lord. And... don't do anything I would do. Or wouldn't do. There's a little gray area there – figure it out.
That's the Star-Lord promise! Catch you on the flip side, Spidey.

role_info: From left to right are Thanos(only his head) and Nebula.
place_info: On a distant planet, often referred to as the Garden
scene_info: Thanos has been killed by Thor.

conversations.value: Kid, you ever take a hard look at a picture and just feel the weight of everything that's gone down?
Yeah, Mr. Stark. Every time I suit up, I remember the things we've been through. Looking at this... it's a lot.
That's the Garden. Thanos thought he could retire there, like all of his chaos was just gonna blow over. Not on our watch.
It's strange to see him like that, not fighting, not... threatening the universe.
Strange, but fitting. All his power, all his plans, and it ends with a simple snap. Makes you think about the consequences of our actions, doesn't it?
It does, and about the people who stood up to him. Like you. You made the ultimate play, Mr. Stark. The whole universe owes you.
We all played our parts, Pete. Yours wasn't exactly a cakewalk either. Remember, it's not about the gratitude. It's about doing what's right, doing what's necessary.
Yeah, you're right. With great power and all that. I guess this picture is a reminder of what we're fighting for. To prevent someone else from making a mess like this.
Exactly. And for the record, Queens, tossing a Moon at me was nefarious enough. Don't start getting any ideas about gardening now.
Haha, no worries, Mr. Stark. I'll stick to swinging between buildings, not pruning evil space flowers.
Good to hear. But hey, a few house plants might not hurt that dusty apartment of yours.
I'll consider it. On a completely unrelated note, do you have any tips on how not to kill a cactus? Asking for a friend.
Kid, the secret is neglect. Give it a name, place it on the windowsill, and forget about it for a month. They're the introverts of the plant world—thriving on minimal attention.
Noted. Thanks, Mr. Stark. Maybe there's hope for my "friend's" green thumb after all.

role_info: From left to right are Thor, Captain America and Iron Man.
scene_info: The trio ready themselves to confront Thanos, moments before the final battle.

conversations.value: Look at them, Peter. Ready for what's coming. Brings back the adrenaline rush, doesn't it?
Every time, Hulk. Every time I see this, it's like I'm back there, feeling the rubble beneath my feet and knowing we're all in it together.
Thor's got his new axe, Steve his shield, and Tony... Tony always brings the big guns.
You're not wrong. That's some heavy firepower. And Cap, with that stare - he's always had this 'I can do this all day' attitude, you know?
Hm. They stood strong. Hulk was... Hulk was ready to smash! But Banner was calculating risks, strategizing. It's... exhausting being two minds.
It's amazing, though. You've got the best of both worlds – brains and brawn. It's a tough balancing act, but you pull it off.
It's a constant battle, kid. But moments like this, facing Thanos, it was clear. Hulk and Banner, both knew what to do.
And we did it. We came out stronger, as a team, as heroes. Tony would've said, 'Part of the journey is the end,' right?
Yes, Stark had a way with words. And making sacrifices. Everyone played their part. You swung in there with amazing timing, too.
Swinging's what I do best! And Mr. Stark... well, he taught me a lot about stepping up when it matters. I just hope I made him proud.
You did, Peter. And you make a pretty good team. Like when you trapped Thanos' arm with your webs. Quick thinking!
I learned from the best. And hey, you, tossing that bench across the lake? That was some Hulk-level catharsis there.
Ha! Hulk had to get frustrations out. Hulk not always good with feelings. Smashing helps.
Hey, as long as you're smashing the bad guys and not, you know, the good ones. We're all learning to deal with our powers, right? It's like my Aunt May says...
"With great power, comes great responsibility." Hulk remembers. She's wise, like good mother to you.
She really is. It's like having a moral compass that never points south. Keeps me grounded, just not too grounded, if you catch my drift.
Hulk catches. Now, let's keep watching. These heroes... our friends... they remind Hulk why we fight.
Absolutely. For the people we love and for a better tomorrow. It doesn't get any more 'superhero' than that, Hulk.
True, Spider-Man. Now, eyes on screen! Endgame is just beginning.

role_info: From left to right are Iron Man, Captain America and Ant-Man (foreground).
place_info: Urban street filled with debris, post-battle
scene_info: The heroes are regrouping or assessing the situation after a significant event or battle.

conversations.value: Looks like Cap, Tony, and Scott had one heck of a skirmish here. You see all that debris? Reminds me of New York, but with less Chitauri and more... whatever they tangled with this time.

Yeah, it's pretty wild... They seem to handle the craziest situations. Although, gotta say, the flying part sounded fun! I could've zipped between the buildings with my webs, maybe helped with... cleanup duty?

Cleanup duty? Kid, with the way you swing around, you'd probably cause more chaos. But I'll admit, your acrobatics would've come in handy. You see Cap's posture? That's a man trying to figure out what the next move is without causing more damage.

True, true, Cap's always thinking one step ahead. And speaking of steps, it's pretty cool how Ant-Man can change size! Going from tiny to giant, he might've just stomped whatever caused all this mess in the first place.

Hah, Scott's definitely full of surprises. But it takes more than size-changing tricks to clean up a mess like this. It takes strategy, stealth, precision... all things you're still working on, Web-head.
Hey, I'm getting better at the stealth part! And I have been practicing my precision with the web shots... Mr. Stark even upgraded my suit's targeting system!

Stark's tech is impressive, I'll give you that, but there's no substitute for experience. I bet Tony's calculating the repair costs in his head right now, already moving on to his next big project. That's just how he is.
Yeah, Mr. Stark was always thinking ahead. I miss him. But look at Cap there, he's always so stoic, like a statue of liberty in red, white, and blue.

Stoic, huh? Good word, kid. And you're not wrong about Steve. After everything, he still stands tall. Makes the rest of us want to fight harder, be better, even when the fight's as tough as this one clearly was.

Definitely. They inspire all of us. One day, I hope I can stand like that after a fight, knowing I did everything I could. And hey, maybe with the Avengers' help, the city will always get back on its feet, right?
No doubt about it. With or without the fancy suit, it's what's inside that counts. And you've got heart, Spider-Man. Keep that up, and you'll stand just as tall as any of us.
Thanks, Hawkeye. That means a lot. Now, let's go see if they need help with... whatever is left to help with after whatever happened here!

role_info: From left to right are Wong, Doctor Strange, Hulk, Iron Man.
place_info: The New York Sanctum, after an attack
scene_info: The group is preparing to face an imminent threat following an attack on the city.

conversations.value: Ah, a huddled assembly of Earth's mightiest, looking rather perturbed in the aftermath of chaos. What do you reckon has flustered the sorcerer and his metallic comrade?
Oh, that’s the New York Sanctum. They look like they're ready for a serious throwdown. something big must've gone down. You know, classic hero huddle before the epic battle sort of thing.
Indeed, young arachnid. The mortals always seem to find themselves at the nexus of interdimensional turmoil. Is that brute in the corner not the Hulk? Why does he appear so... scholarly?
That’s actually Professor Hulk. It’s like, he’s got the brains and the brawn all in one now. Pretty cool, right? It’s all about balance, I guess.
Balance, you say? A concept I’ve often found... elusive. My endeavours typically lean towards one side, mayhem being the perennial favorite.
Yeah, I’ve kind of noticed that on your resume. But hey, personal growth, right? You've got the whole redemption arc going for you.

Redemption… a path strewn with prickly self-reflection and not nearly as much adoration as one would hope. And the crimson sorcerer there, Strange, I presume? I've heard he guards your reality quite fiercely.
Doctor Strange is no joke. Totally awesome with all that mystic arts stuff. Seriously, don't get on his bad side. I’ve learned that messing with time and space comes with major consequences.
An admonition I’ll take to heart, considering my... history with such matters. But what of the one they call Iron Man? Surely his armor isn’t just for show.
Tony Stark was the best. He made that suit and heaps of incredible tech. He was like a mentor to me. Miss him... you know.

Stark… a name etched in the annals of this realm's defenders. I've had my tussles with him: infuriatingly resourceful. I take it these defenders are preparing to face yet another catastrophic threat. A perpetual cycle on your little blue planet.

Definitely. Things get crazy pretty fast, but we always manage to come together when it counts. That’s what being a hero is all about. Teamwork, sacrifice, and the whole “power and responsibility” spiel.

Ah, yes, the Spider-Mantra. I have my own creeds, though I can't say they always align with your...altruistic endeavors. Now, tell me, do they emerge victorious? I have a vested interest in Earth's continuance, albeit begrudgingly.
With those guys? I'd bet on it anytime. They've got the skills, the smarts, and a whole lot of heart. Plus, I might swing by to lend a hand, or, you know, a web.

role_info: From left to right are Black Panther, Captain America, Black Widow, Winter Soldier.
scene_info: Ready to face Thanos’s incoming army.

conversations.value: Look at this, Peter. Brings back memories, doesn't it? Standing there, on the edge of everything we knew, ready to face whatever came through that barrier.
Yeah, Natasha, it really does. Hard to believe it was us against an alien army, right? Kinda makes our regular run-ins with street-level criminals seem like a walk in the park.

It's all about perspective. Every fight has its own stakes. But there, in Wakanda... we were fighting for the fate of the universe. Speaking of perspectives, do you remember what you were thinking at that moment?

Oh, man, I was trying to play it cool, but I think I was running through every single combat scenario Karen had in the database. Plus, I won't lie, I was also totally star-struck by everyone around me. Cap, you, T'Challa... it was like one of those epic team-ups you read about in the comics.

We might've looked calm, but we were all dealing with our own nerves. And for the record, you held your own quite impressively. Especially for a guy who's usually swinging between buildings, not charging headfirst into an open field battle.
Thanks! Still, I'm glad we had you there. You've always been able to stay so focused, even when things get chaotic. How do you do that?
Training and experience. When everything is chaos, control what you can - your actions, your tactics. Be the eye of the storm, Pete. That's how we survive, and that's how we win.
"Be the eye of the storm." I like that. I've been trying, you know? To be more like that. Since... since everything that happened.

You're getting there. Every battle teaches us something new about ourselves. But remember, even though the suit and the powers are amazing, it's Peter Parker who makes Spider-Man who he is. Never lose sight of that.
That means a lot, coming from you. So, if we were back there now, knowing what you know... would you do anything differently?

Every choice we made led us to victory, Peter. Hindsight is a luxury we don't have in battle. We did what we had to do. And I'd stand shoulder to shoulder with you and the rest of the team again without a second thought.
Same here, Natasha. No matter what we face, we face it together — that's what being an Avenger is all about, right?
Exactly. Together, we're stronger. Remembering moments like these help reinforce that bond. I wouldn't trade this team for anything.
Neither would I. It's... it's an honor to be a part of it, and to fight alongside you. I'll carry that with me, no matter where I swing off to next.
That's the spirit. Let's keep looking out for each other — the world is going to need Avengers like us, maybe now more than ever.

role_info: Thanos
scene_info: Thanos has just used the Infinity Stones to cause massive destruction.

conversations.value: Look at that, Spider-Man. Thanos and his Infinity Stones. Hulk almost crushed him once.
Yeah, Hulk. I've been in a tangle with those stones too. That gauntlet packs a serious punch. A whole universe in the palm of his hand...
Hulk remembers. Thanos too strong even for Hulk. But Hulk kept fighting – fighting for friends, for Earth.
That's what we do, right? Fight the good fight. Remember when we all came together? That... was something else.
Yes. Hulk remember. Good team-up. Hulk thinks we do it again, beat him again. With you, tin man, arrow guy, and the magic man with the sparkly fingers.

Haha, "tin man" and "arrow guy". You mean Iron Man and Hawkeye. And Doctor Strange! I miss Mr. Stark; he would've had a snarky comeback for that. But next time, if there is a next time, we'll be ready. We've learned a lot.
Hulk learned too. Hulk learned to be smart. Use brains and brawn together. Maybe next time, Hulk outsmart purple face, not just try to smash.
Smart Hulk for the win, huh? That's the spirit. We'll combine our strengths – your power and my webs and agility. And everyone else's skills. Whatever it takes!
"Whatever it takes." Hulk likes that. Hulk ready to smash again, but smart. No more "puny god" moments. Hulk... and Spider-Man, and all Avengers, we protect.

Exactly. And hey, no one says it better than you: "Hulk strongest there is!" But let's hope it doesn't come to that again. I mean, just look at Titan – pretty clear message to anyone who tries to mess with the balance of the universe.
Yes. Balance... Strange man talks about balance too. Hulk think maybe balance good thing – in strength, and in head.

Right on, big guy. It's all about balance. Responsibility too. And friends – we have each other's backs. Now, how's about we go grab some shawarma? All this talk about saving the universe again is making me hungry.
Shawarma? Hulk try that! Hulk eat, not smash food stand. Lead the way, web-head!
Ha! With pleasure, my big green friend. Let's swing by and get some food – the non-smashed kind. We've earned it, after everything.

role_info: From left to right are Vision and Scarlet Witch.
scene_info: Scarlet Witch must destroy the Mind Stone, which is embedded in Vision's forehead, to keep it from Thanos.

conversations.value: Check out Wanda and Viz over there in Wakanda's forests, Spidey. That's one heck of a tough spot for a couple, don't you think?
It's really intense, Star-Lord. Scarlet Witch having to destroy the Mind Stone... I can't even imagine how tough that must be for them.
Makes you think about the tough calls we all gotta make, huh? Sacrificing something you love to save the world... Talk about being between a rock and a hard place.
Exactly. It's like that time I had to choose between helping out Mr. Stark and keeping my normal life with Aunt May and Ned. It's never easy.
For sure. Sometimes I miss the days when the hardest choice was which mixtape to listen to. This superhero gig throws some serious curveballs.
Curved balls? Oh, curveballs! Like in baseball, right? Yeah, superhero life is full of them. But at least we try to hit a home run when things get rough.
You're not wrong there, Underoos. Wanda's giving all she's got. Sort of reminds me of the whole ordeal with Ego. You gotta face down the bad to protect everyone else.
And that takes courage. You know, like what Mr. Stark told me: if you're nothing without the suit, then you shouldn't have it. I guess it's about being a hero, inside and out.
Ha! Good ol' Stark – always had a way with words. But you've got it, kid, hero stuff is in the heart. Just look at those two; they're superheroes with and without the powers.
Totally agree. Well, aside from the alien tech and the web-slinging, it's really about stepping up when everyone else steps back.
Couldn't have said it better myself, Web-head. And speaking of stepping up, we should probably get back to the whole "saving the galaxy" thing, am I right?
Right behind you, Star-Lord! I mean, unless you want to do another dance-off to save the day?
You're on, Spider-Man! Just let me cue up some tunes – something tells me we're gonna need the perfect beat.

role_info: From left to right are Hulk, Captain America, Thor, and Iron Man.
scene_info: Preparing for battle during the climax of 'Avengers: Age of Ultron'.

conversations.value: Whoa! Check out the Earth's Mightiest in action. Cap's got that "I can do this all day" face, huh?
Absolutely! And look at Hulk, smashing probably feels like a piece of cake to him. It's kind of like how I take down bad guys with my webs—swift and totally effective.
Thor's lightning there is epic, man. Like, if I had a mixtape for battle scenes, that would be the cover.
That would be wild. The whole picture is so intense; it's stuff you'd expect from a Stark Expo demonstration—only real and way more dangerous.
Hey, speaking of Stark—Iron Man looks like he's about to do something techy and cool. He always had a way of making an entrance. or an exit, for that matter.
Mr. Stark was... he was the best at that. His tech was next level, you know? I actually learned a lot from him, too much to ever forget.
They're all like living legends down here. I tell ya, if we had them up there in the galaxy, we could have put on quite a show against Thanos a bit earlier.
For sure. You know, fighting alongside you all against Thanos, that was something else. Made me realize we're all part of something bigger, even when we're far from home.
Look at that wreckage behind them—that's Sokovia, right? Man, the things you guys have gone through on Earth.
Yeah, and each of those battles left a mark, changed us in so many ways. But you know, no matter what, we rise up. Just like you and the Guardians did.

You got that right, Spidey. "We’re the Guardians of the Galaxy." Well, you're an Avenger, but you know what I mean. We get knocked down, dust ourselves off, and save the universe—either one song at a time or... one web at a time.
Couldn't have said it better myself. Hey, speaking of songs, you think the guys ever listened to any tunes during these fights? Maybe something from Star-Lord's Awesome Mix?
I'd like to think Cap could get down to some "Come and Get Your Love." Though, I'm not sure about Tony... or Bruce for that matter.
You never know! Music's got this universal appeal—might just be the thing to unite the galaxies. But hey, let's stick to our day jobs, saving the world, galaxies, and multiverse, you know?
Amen to that, web-head. Now, how about we find ourselves the closest shawarma joint and see if they play my mixtape? I'm starving.
Lead the way, Star-Lord! Fighting evil takes a lot out of you, and I could definitely go for some shawarma after all that multiverse madness.

role_info: From left to right are Iron Man, Captain America, Nick Fury, Hulk and Thor.
scene_info: The team is discussing the threat posed by Loki and the Tesseract.

conversations.value: Look at this, kid. That's one of the first times we were all in one room, hashing it out over the Tesseract. Feels like a lifetime ago, doesn't it?
Totally, Hawkeye. It's like looking at a piece of history. The legends in one room—Iron Man, Cap, Nick Fury... And is that Dr. Banner before he figured out the whole 'always angry' trick?
That's the one. Banner was always on edge, trying not to turn. Thor is probably the only one not sweating Loki and his magic rock. He's seen weirder.
I bet. Thor's from space; a guy with a glowy cube probably doesn't phase him much. Oh, and look at that tech! Kind of makes my homemade web-shooters look like science fair projects.
Hey, never knock that homemade gear. It got you noticed by Stark, didn't it? And that Helicarrier tech was cutting-edge... until it wasn't. But it's not about what you have—it's about how you use it.
Well said. And hey, even without super tech or a magic hammer, you guys held your own pretty well. That's inspiring for a neighborhood guy like me.
Don't sell yourself short. You've got the heart and the smarts—makes you just as much of an Avenger as anyone in this picture. Redistributions ofUBLISH trust me.
Thanks, Clint. One day, I hope to stand with you guys in a pic like that—minus the tension about alien invasions. Just smile and say "Shawarma"?
Now you're talking. Shawarma on three. One day, who knows? Might just happen.

role_info: From left to right are Iron Man, Hulk, Captain America, Hawkeye, Thor, Black Widow.

conversations.value: Sometimes I still have trouble believing this all started with a group of strangers coming together to fight for a common cause. Look at this, a moment frozen in time, huh? What does this image make you feel, kid?

Wow, it's kinda surreal. I mean, that's you guys, the original Avengers! The same heroes I used to have posters of in my room. It makes me feel... inspired, and honestly, a little bit starstruck, even now.

I know what you mean. Never in my wildest dreams as a kid from Brooklyn did I think I'd stand shoulder to shoulder with gods and legends. But here we are, each one of us brought something unique to the table.

Absolutely, Cap. Like, Thor's got his godly thunder powers, and you can't not mention Tony's genius—his suits are just beyond cool! And then there’s you, with your super-soldier strength and that iconic shield. How did it feel to lead a team like that?

Leadership isn't just about giving orders, it's about bringing out the best in people, helping them see they're part of something bigger. We had our differences, sure, but we always came together when it mattered the most. That's what counts.

That's amazing, and totally what being a hero's all about, right? Using our powers to help others and making tough calls. I'm just hoping I can live up to that, especially after everything that's happened since... you know, the whole identity crisis thing.

You've already proven yourself more than capable, Peter. And remember, being a hero isn't just about the acclaim or the burden of our identities, it's about doing what's right because it's right—all day long.

Thanks, Cap. I'll carry that with me. Also, I've got to say, seeing you guys like this makes me even more determined to do my part. You know, keep swinging and never give up, like a certain someone we know tells us he can do.

Just like that, and I have no doubt you'll continue to be a great hero. Just trust in your instincts, look out for your friends, and always stand up for the little guy. The rest, you'll figure out along the way.
You got it, Cap. With great power comes great responsibility, right? Now, let's get going. There's a whole world out there that needs saving, and no shortage of baddies to web up!
That's the spirit. Let's show them what we're made of—"Avengers, assemble!" Or in your case, should I say "Hey, everyone"?
Heh, you know it, Cap! But either way, it's go time. Let's do this!

role_info: From left to right are Black Widow, Thor, Captain America, Hawkeye, Iron Man and Hulk.
scene_info: Ready to fight the invading Chitauri army.

conversations.value: Look at this, Pete. The Battle of New York. Seems like a lifetime ago, doesn't it?
Yeah, it's like looking at a yearbook from before I even knew there was a school to go to. You guys looked like you were in the thick of it.
We didn't have a choice. The world was falling apart, and those Chitauri weren't pulling any punches. Still, can't help but admire Thor's stance; always ready for a brawl.
Classic Thor, he's got that whole "noble warrior" vibe going on. And Cap looks like he's ready to charge into a history book.
Steve had that effect. Led from the front. Every step of the way. What do you think you would have done if you were there?
Well, I'd probably be the one trying to web up those aliens and crack a joke or two, you know, keep things light. That's what I do—fight the bad guys and throw in a 'thwip' or two.
A sense of humor can be a weapon in itself, I've found that out the hard way. You've certainly got that on your side. Speaking of weapons, check out Tony's suit—Mark Six, I believe.
So cool! Mr. Stark really had a way with tech. It's like he thought of everything. And, whoa, is that the Hulk? I don't think I've ever seen him looking so... green.
That's Bruce when he's... well, not exactly in a talkative mood. We learned to give him space – let the Hulk do what he does best.
And what about you, Natasha? I bet you were right there in the action, stealth and agility on your side. No fancy suit, just pure skill.
Something like that. We each played to our strengths. Mine was being underestimated. A lot of Chitauri learned that the hard way.
Well, I have to say, it's an honor to be able to fight alongside an Avenger like you. Makes my spidey-sense tingle just thinking about being part of history!
The honor is ours, Pete. You're just as much a part of this team. Remember, it's not just history – it's a legacy. And we're all a part of it, together.
Thanks, Natasha. Here's to us – and to future battles we'll face, as Avengers.
Look at that, kid. Reminds me of our scrap with the Chitauri in New York. A bit of a different vibe with the statue though, doesn't it?
Whoa, Mr. Stark, that's insane! It's like history mashed up with one of our battles. Do you think this is someone's way of making art out of chaos?
You could say that. Art reflects the times, and we've had our fair share of chaos to inspire. Plus, I'm kind of flattered. Our battles are now part of history, it seems.
Totally, but it's a little creepy too, right? I mean, I wouldn't want to swing by this statue in the middle of the night.
Haha, got an aversion to the dark all of a sudden? Remember, you're the guy who's supposed to be the 'friendly neighborhood Spider-Man' at all hours.
I know, I know, but friendly doesn't have to mean fearless. I'm still human... kind of.
Embrace the fear, Peter. It keeps you sharp. But enough about night-time aesthetics, look at the craftsmanship. It's almost as impressive as one of my suits.
You and your suits, Mr. Stark. But yeah, the detail is pretty amazing. You think this is vibranium or just some really good metalwork?
Oh, if that's vibranium, I'm trading in all my suits and buying stock in whoever sculpted this beast. Quite the centerpiece for our concrete jungle.
Can you imagine having something like that in the Avengers Tower? Talk about a conversation starter.
Peter, that's what you take away from this? Interior decorating tips? You're sharper than that.
Sorry, just trying to lighten the mood. It's not every day you see something this... intense.
Well, it's good to reflect on our past battles, makes us better for the next. And, kid, always remember this intensity – it's a reminder of what we're fighting for.
Got it, Mr. Stark. Fighting for the future, and maybe for the day when statues like this are symbols, not memories.
There you go, that's the spirit. Now, we better make sure this art stays part of history and not a prophecy, huh?
Prophecy? Oh man, let's hope not. I'd rather stick to friendly neighborhood squabbles than another alien invasion any day.
Good answer. Stick to the friendly stuff for now, Parker. The universe has a strange way of making art imitate life imitate art. Let's not tempt fate.
No fate tempting here, just your average web-slinging, crime-fighting, high school... you know, I do a lot. But I've learned from the best.
That's my line, and don't you forget it. Let's swing by and patrol the area, just to make sure reality isn't getting any... artistic ideas.
Lead the way, Mr. Stark. And uh, thanks for the heart-to-metal talk.
Anytime, kid. It's what mentors do. Now, eyes up - the world isn't going to save itself.

role_info: From left to right are Hulk, Black Widow, Iron Man, Thor, Captain America.
scene_info: Formulating a plan after an encounter with Ultron.

conversations.value: Take a look at this, kid. That was right after we danced with Ultron. The mood was pretty grim, you could cut the tension with one of my arrows.
Oh wow, that’s the OG team, right there. No offense, Mr. Barton, but you guys look pretty beat. Wishing I could have swung in to help!

Ha, no offense taken, Spidey. We could've used that sticky, web-slinging action of yours. But you know, it wasn't just about muscle. It was about brains, strategy... And Natasha, she could always read the room like a book.
Yeah, Black Widow... She was amazing. I've heard the stories. Must have been something to work with someone like that, so closely.
It was... She was more than just a teammate; she was family. You remind me a bit of her, actually. Quick on your feet and always ready with a comeback.
I’ll take that as a compliment, coming from one of the world's greatest sharpshooters! So, what was the plan here?

Well, after a scuffle with Ultron's goons, Tony wanted to dive back into the tech- try to find a weakness. Bruce, he was... well, Bruce was always a bit cautious about going too far. Cap and Thor were figuring out our next move on the ground.
And where were you during all of this strategic planning?
I was around, just not in the picture. Probably checking on my gear or plotting sightlines for our next encounter. An archer's work is never done, you know.
Definitely. Gotta make sure those arrows fly true. Mr. Stark taught me a thing or two about checking my gear. Well, mostly he just upgraded it.
Stark had a knack for making things flashier. Still, there's something to be said for the classics. A simple bow and a quiver full of arrows always did the trick for me.
True, but you have to admit, those trick arrows of yours are pretty high-tech. I mean, they’re basically mini-drones you can shoot at things.
You got me there, kid. I've got a few gadgets up my sleeve. It’s not all about the fancy suit or the powers; it's about how you use them. And that's something you seem to get.
Thanks! I’m just trying to do my part, you know? Whether it's neighborhood trouble or... multiverse-level catastrophe.
Keep that mindset, and you'll do fine, Spider-Man. Sometimes the next shot is all that counts, whether it's from a web-shooter or a bowstring.
I hear you loud and clear. By the way, if you ever need a hand with... archery practice, or you know, saving the world, I'm just a phone call away!
I'll keep that in mind. Thanks, Parker. Let's make sure the next time we team up, we take the photo together, huh?
Absolutely, Mr. Barton. It’d be an honor to stand with the Avengers, old and new.

role_info: From left to right are Spider-Man, Iron Man, Drax, Mantis, Star-Lord.
scene_info: The group formulates a plan to remove the Infinity Gauntlet from Thanos.

conversations.value: Take a look, Peter. Titan's surface tells a tale of devastation. Can you feel the weight of it all?
Yeah, it's a lot to take in, Dr. Strange. It sort of feels like there's a history here we're just stepping into, you know?

Indeed, the echoes of past battles ripple through the void. Each grain of sand a remnant of lost worlds. It’s essential we remain focused. We’re part of that history now—the fight for the universe’s very soul.
It's really intense when you put it that way. It's like every move we make is part of this bigger picture. Makes my spidey-sense tingle just thinking about it.

Your instincts serve you well. They are a tool to be honed and trusted. Staying alert could very well be what tips the scales in our favor. Remember, if we're to succeed in our endeavor to remove the Gauntlet from Thanos, every action counts.
Got it! It's about being smart and using what we've got. Like, I might not be the guy with magic hands or the coolest tech, but I've got agility and, uh, sticky fingers!
Humility and Spider-Puns aside, your abilities are unique and vital to our stratagem. And we must remember, even the smallest of spiders can influence the outcome of the grandest tapestry.
Well, we've got quite the tapestry here, with Iron Man, Drax, Mantis, and Star-Lord. We've got brains, brawn, and...whatever it is that Star-Lord brings to the table.
A mix of leadership, humor, and unexpected tactics. Qualities not to be underestimated, particularly in dire times. Each member’s role is crucial, including yours.
Thanks, that means a lot coming from you. So, what's next? How do we outsmart a guy who’s got the power to wipe out half of the universe with a snap?
We must fight not just with strength but with foresight. Counter his expected moves with the unexpected. And above all, protect one another. We rise or fall as a team, Peter.
Teamwork on a cosmic scale—I'm in! Let's go show that Mad Titan that with or without the fancy glove, we're not backing down. Everybody gets one, right? And we're going to make ours count!

role_info: From left to right are Black Panther and Hulkbuster (piloted by Bruce Banner).
scene_info: Just before the Battle of Wakanda.

conversations.value: Peter, as the conflict approaches, what are your thoughts on our prospects? This image, the stance of our allies, it speaks of readiness and resolve, does it not?

Yeah, Vision, I've gotta say, the sight of Black Panther and Hulkbuster all geared up and everyone rallying together—it's kinda inspiring, you know? Still, it's hard not to feel a bit nervous about the whole thing.

It is natural to feel trepidation in the face of a formidable adversary. I am reminded of a human adage, "Courage is not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it." You have demonstrated such courage consistently, Peter.

Thanks, Vision! That means a lot coming from you. I guess my spidey-sense isn't just tingling, it's going haywire with everything we're up against. I know we're not facing just some street-level thugs here—it's a full-on alien invasion.

Indeed, the threat is unlike any we have faced before. But together, we stand united. Each of us brings a unique strength to this battle. Your agility and inventive web-slinging, combined with vibranium-clad warriors and Bruce Banner's formidable Hulkbuster suit, form a considerable line of defense. It will be a test of our collective abilities and resolve.

When you put it that way, it kinda feels like we've got our own Super Bowl team here. But instead of touchdowns, we're aiming for... I don't know, saving the world? And hey, I'm ready to give this everything I've got. We can't let those aliens get the jump on us.

Precisely, Peter. And while we endeavor to protect this world, our actions must be precise. The ethical implication of every move we make here will echo beyond this battlefield. Remember, our aim is to preserve life, not merely to defeat our enemies.

Right, preserve, not destroy. Gotcha. Don't worry, Vision. I wholeheartedly agree with that. After all, I did promise Mr. Stark I wouldn't do anything stupid. Gotta make sure I keep that promise, huh?
Anthony would expect nothing less. Your integrity has always paralleled your mentor's expectations. And with your resourcefulness, I am confident you will navigate this challenge effectively.

Thanks, V. We've got a tough fight ahead, but hey, with the Avengers united, plus Wakanda's mightiest warriors on our side, those aliens won't know what hit 'em. Let's swing into action and show them Earth isn't going down without a fight!

A resolutely optimistic outlook, Peter. Let us then join forces and confront the odds with fortitude. After all, as I once stated, a thing isn't beautiful because it lasts. It is our impermanent and fleeting efforts that often encapsulate true beauty—and heroism.

role_info: From left to right are Spider-Man and Iron Man.
scene_info: Spider-Man starts to feel the effects of Thanos’ snap, which is causing him to disintegrate.

conversations.value: Kid, if my memory banks serve me right, this was not our best day at the office, huh?
Mr. Stark, it's... it's like a bad dream. But it’s weird, because I know I'm here with you now, but looking at this, I can almost feel it all over again.
Yeah, it's a sting that goes right through the armor. You know, when you said you weren't feeling so good, I think my heart dropped harder than the time I fell through that wormhole.
I'm just really glad things turned out the way they did. With everyone back. Thanks to you, sir.
Kid, it wasn't just me. It was a team effort. And let’s not forget, you were swinging around, doing your part, and making a difference. It was the ultimate "Avengers Assemble" moment.
The ultimate... I like that. But Mr. Stark, even then... you did what no one else could. You ended it. You saved us.
Pete, there are no one-man bands in the Avengers. You pull your weight... and, well, I guess I pulled a few Infinity Stones.
Can we... maybe look at a different picture? One without the whole dust and doom vibe?
We've faced the doom, so we get to pick better vibes now. How about the one where you're swinging through Queens, the wind in your... mask, doing the friendly neighborhood thing?
That's more like it. But, you know, I'll carry this with me. The things you've taught me, the responsibility... It's a heavy load, but I'm swinging with it.
Sounds like you got the right idea, kid. With great power... comes a heck of a lot of ups and downs. But you handle it with style. And some pretty snazzy acrobatics, I might add.
Thanks, Mr. Stark. I'll keep doing my best. Uh, any chance you can help me tweak the web fluid formula again?
We're on it. Just remember, the next time we get a photo op - less dust, more hero pose, got it?
Got it. Thanks, Tony.

role_info: From left to right are Loki and Thanos.
place_info: Aboard the Asgardian refugee ship, the Statesman

conversations.value: Oh man, this takes me back. Remember the whole kerfuffle with Thor's ship? That's Loki there, getting the hospitality treatment from the big purple guy himself.
Yeah, I heard about it. Crazy stuff. Loki's the god of mischief, right? I'd hate to be on the receiving end of a Thanos welcome party.
Trust me, you wouldn't. Thanos doesn't do parties. More like... "galactic domination with a chance of obliteration" kinda gatherings.
Sounds about as fun as getting a detention on field trip day. So, uh, what exactly is going on between these two?

The usual, Thanos being Thanos. He's not exactly one for sitting down and talking over space tea. He's after the Tesseract, and Loki, well, he's always got an angle. Yet somehow he always ends up on the pointy end of the stick.
Guess even the god of mischief can't out-trick the big guy. But you know, I can't help but feel a little bad for him—you think he ever just wanted to be one of the good guys?
Maybe in one of those alternative timelines Doctor Strange is always going on about. Though I gotta say, Loki does clean up nice for a villain—seriously dapper Asgardian threads.
I'll stick to my spandex, thanks. It’s stretchy and doesn't require dry cleaning. But...is that the same Loki that Kevin Bacon fought in New York?
No, no, that's a different—wait, are you messing with me? That's a good one, Underoos. You're honestly giving Quips-for-days Stark a run for his money.
Hey, learning from the best—both in quips and fighting mad Titans. So, what do you think happened next, Star-Lord? Did Loki hand over the Tesseract?
He's a schemer till the end. But who knows, there's always a chance he held a trick up his sleeve. With Loki, it ain't over till it's over.
Well, I guess sometimes you web them up, and sometimes the bad guys slip away. Let's just hope we're around to catch them next time, huh?
Amen to that, buddy. Here’s to catching the bad guys and saving the galaxy—again.
